The callback must ALWAYS be called, so here is a few problems.
There is no return false for the async processing. And in case of an exception in try .. catch, you need to call callback.done(true) also (for example if mandatory body throws exception), which can be done in a finally block, or just above return true etc.
You may want to set that exception on exchange, so Camel can react upon that.

Here you need to return false after submit, as its another thread that continues this callback, so return false, and then return false from the process method that called this, then Camel knows its async now.
Yes this is correct, after we have the response we can tell Camel to continue by calling false on the callback
return true to know that it was processed sync
Can we make a better exception message what this means?

Can you please use something else as java.beans is some very old crap in Java that is bloated and may make quarkus pull in alot of extra classes.
Instead add you own little event listener api
